title: What happens if your child hasn't been going to school, and you didn't know? - Quora

response.answer_text: Greetings, Most public schools carefully track attendance. At my school, a classified staff member call the home of every absent student around 10:00 AM to verify that they are missing classes for a legitimate reason. My colleagues are required to take attendance every period, and we receive “reminder calls” if too much time passes without the office receiving the results of roll call. And, when a minor returns to school, each is required to have written parental notice requesting that the absence be excused. However, after several days of absence without notice, and calls to the parent’s place of employment, our principal makes a home visit. I am surprised that you have not been contacted. Sincerely, AJG.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Brandon C. Njichop

response.answer_text: In my school, if you don’t show up, they immediately contact your parents. Attendance is taken every period and if you aren’t where you are supposed to be and weren’t cleared by the attendance office, they will call your parents to see where you are. If your child doesn’t go to school and they don’t have excuse notes you can be fined and have to go to court. It is your responsibility to ensure your child is attending school. Even if your child leaves school as soon as you drop them off, it is your responsibility. Depending how long they haven’t been going to school you can face jail time or pay a hefty fine.
